title: Seed cake making and general camp activity (A)
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
description: Episode number 1 of Series "People of the Australian Western Desert (A)"  Scenes typical of the daily life of nomadic Aborigines of the Pintubi tribe in desert conditions, filmed in the Clutterbuck Hills area, Western Australia. The women of the family group gather grass seed. Back in camp, surrounded by their family they make seed cake.
related_objects: Series; S00570; People of the Australian western desert (A); Active; 1970
